remarks: In a k-regular graph, the size of the set of walks of length n starting with a fixed vertex and ending not at this vertex is the difference between k to the power of n and the size of the set of walks of length n starting with this vertex and ending at this vertex.  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Sep-2018.)
